lKccBsG-Vot9kmdDTCxoDw.text: Decent without being amazing. They aren't afraid to flavor things generously with spices. Wish I had tried more. I would definitely go back again to give some of the other dishes a try.

nfUTj5wn5KSyxvQvQKvEfg.text: This is really a great restaurant. Its not particularly cheap, but its a premium restaurant in the centre of London, near one of the capital's most well known landmarks, Trafalgar Square. I can't recommend one particular meal here. There are so many good dishes. The staff are extremely friendly and can help you decide. Inside, its fairly sophisticated, the sort of place you could take out your partner, conduct a business meeting or go for a family meet up. Downstairs, there is a club linked to the restaurant, and its also quite sophisticated. I haven't been in it on the weekends so I don't know how busy it is, but overall, if you want a good evening in one place, which is guaranteed to be top class, or combine it with nearby galleries, I would say Thai Square ticks all the boxes. Charing Cross is the closest tube station.

kpPMQwHfmYKCBH8GA3VStQ.text: I had always been intrigued by this luxurious looking restaurant as I passed by on the bus, but had always assumed it'd be out of my price range. However, I was pleased to find it is actually pretty reasonable - averaging at just over £10 for a main and side, so i decided to go there with some family last week. We wanted something special but not overly formal and what an excellent choice it turned out to be. The hotel-like entrance complete with fountains and gold decor, along with waitresses dressed in evening wear give the allusion of grandeur, and the views out to Trafalgar Square are amazing. Better than this was the food, which was amazing. I had a green thai curry, and others went for sweet and sour chicken and cashew nuts. All was beautifully served and couldn't be faulted on taste. The wine was also excellent.I am simply amazed by this place. The food, location, decor and service could command a much higher price, but instead you can enjoy a night of privilege without coming near to breaking the bank. I couldn't recommend it more.

1BzEExp2NWdaGoaeO_b_Wg.text: We checked into our Trafalgar hotel hungry after a long flight and asked about a place to eat close by. This place was recommended. We got there at ten to three when they close their lunch kitchen at three but they happily accomodated us. Their pad thai blew me away. Best I have had. A nice clean, well decorated place with great service. It is a white table cloth restaurant, but there were lots of people dressed very informally. It looked like a lot of local business people come for lunch, which itself is a good recommendation. We were wanting to try out several places in London, but this was so good we had to come back for dinner. I had a lamb curry with coconut rice that was really outstanding. They did not even serve it with a knife because none was needed. The meat fell off the bone with a light touch of the fork. The curry sauce was rich and delectable. My wife had the pad thai noodles because she was so impressed after tasting mine at lunch, and she was delighted with them also. Highly recommended.

ciqD51jDcxZYwrFQ0nxPhg.text: Thai Square is in the heart of central London - a commanding restaurant on Cockspur Street, the entrance boasts a gorgeous water fountain with gold thai statues at either side.The food at Thai Square is D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S.  I really couldn't fault it. The prawn dumplings are gorgeous, as was the prawn pandang - the creamiest, tastiest sauce. Sure, my date and I enjoyed a bottle of Moet & Chandon Rose with dinner, but I'm sure the food would've been amazing regardless!Amazing service, linen napkins and most main courses around the £10 mark.  A great place for a date that is super special, but won't break the bank. Incredible.

tKYTM81WybjEHdn8ClZQgA.text: Food was good (just as good as Silicon Valley restaurants).  This is the third time we had been here, but the service, food, and atmosphere was so much better.  They didn't have my favorite, Ginger Chicken, on the menu, but they made it for me anyway.  It was very tasty.  We has a Blue Slate Dr. Loosen Reisling-- fantastic with the Thai food.  I highly recommend this place and its very convenient being located in Trafalgar Square.

77Xyx_Qa0BXOnkYESBulUw.text: Admittedly in the past I had not been happy with Thai Square but I was in the area and wanted Thai food so my wife and I stopped in. The good news is that service was dramatically better than before (2 years back) and the food was simply outstanding. The decor was very nice but the music didn't seem to match.  The hostess was very welcoming and sat us quickly and exactly where we wanted. The waitresses where very nice, efficient and always present but not intrusive throughout the meal. They were also accommodated our request for items not on the menu. We started with a appetizer sampler with satay chicken, dumplings, crab cakes, shrimp toast, and fried spring rolls. All were very tasty and fresh with nice flavorful slightly spicy peanut sauce  and a spicy sweet chilly sauce. Neither of our entrees, ginger chicken and chicken pad siew, were on the menu but both were outstanding. The ginger chicken had excellent flavoring without over doing the ginger and the chicken and vegetables were fresh and nicely cooked (My wife thought it was one of the best she has ever had). The chicken pad siew was also outstanding with noodles, chicken and vegetables perfectly cooked. Although the flavor differs from what I am used to in the US it was still very, very good. Lastly the chocolate molten cake with vanilla pod ice cream was decadent without going overboard and was one of the best I have had (the only competitor would be the one from Gotham Bar and Grill in New York). Overall the food was good to the point that you want to lick the plate clean. I definitely planning on going here again!Note: It was nice that the are open until 10:30 pm.

qSkQlIvM3ON2y81ZPw_uBw.text: Thai square is one place to be at in Trafalgar Square. One fantastic monument. With a special menu for the season, this is a nice place to enjoy this festive season. The chef's recommendation is exquisite. If you have never tried the Pad Thai Kai it will be a thrilling experience. Pak Toon is fancy vegetarian dish. You will be amazed at how close to Thailand you can be. There is absolutely enough seating for as many friends or families. Indulge yourself and luxuriate in this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Thai Square

sb579bm3GjyDkKMPkkXXGA.text: Great Thai Food.  We are vegans and it's not easy to find food.  This restaurant had plenty of choices and the staff was friendly and accommodating.

_F-H_pX1rkvvL4YugVOTmA.text: All the Thai square restaurants have good food, this one is also a very impressive place and has a cool little bar downstairs, which has good music and a much friendlier crowd than other west end bars

U3gZDDryDsOWDKGAJb0kSA.text: Very convinient location, gorgeous entrance, and pretty good food here.  Their wine recommendations were also good.  We were recommended some French regional whites that really went well with the Asian food.

g8dvWEh9LHt81VFoO-wvcw.text: We went there on a Friday evening with four people and without a reservation, but we were lucky. The staff was very friendly and the service was prompt and perfect. On the menu they have a broad variety of dishes with good descriptions of what you should expect. We had papaya salad as a starter and that was delicious. Our four different main courses were also really good; every dish with its own character. The drinks menu is also more than decent with a broad wine and cocktail selection. The location at Trafalgar Square is of course great and we were really impressed with the ambience and decor.

pqpSwh5C_n3sLGBuZbCWiQ.text: not too sure about the restaurant as i never tried...a shame i haven't yet as i heard good things and i love a good thai!anyways downstairs they have a nightclub which i use to often go to!i have good memories going there.it is free for ladies to get in whilst guys have to pay!the drinks are overpriced which is why i never buy any.its really tiny and with the amount of people who go here they should have a minimum capicity of how many ppl should enter!the floor is easily slippery.the only good point is the music.ive spend my birthday here once and was one of the best but i guess it depends on the people you're with that adds up to the experience.its worth the visit but its so overcrowded.

YteljnxeTqoT8a5smyTqbQ.text: I  to be really impressed with Thai Square, but not so much now. I would describe the food as average (the starters - less than average and a little bland). I must admit, the decor at this particular branch is beautiful - ornate decoration, attention to detail and traditional costume for the girl providing the music. Maybe it was because it was a Friday night, but the service wasn't the greatest. They took forever to take our order and when they eventually took the order, the starter came out first - before even getting the drinks. To add to the evening, we had a rocky table, so we had to get that fixed (i.e the waiter crawled under our table and shoved folded bits of their menu under the table leg - all very awkward lol); a bee was circling my wine glass, so had to get that replaced. In addition, considering we booked a table, I think we were just given some random table that was free - disappointingly, the table by the door . All in all, a rather disappointing evening, with mediocre food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Coconut rice
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Entertainment for the evening

2XfjchaPQHZ_rGiuRq4adw.text: If you're around Trafalgar Square for lunch, they have a limited but good lunch menu for £7.50.  I'm a big green curry fan so definitely like going for the lunch box on that one.  Food is definitely reliable but the service... can.. be... so... slow... I find it a real treat if I don't eat at my desk for lunch so when I do eat out - I'd like them to hurry up please!  We had to wave at the wait staff almost 3 times for us to take our order and about twice to ask for the bill.  Understand that it is crowded during lunch but makes me want to get take away and just eat at my desk!

r_SBhwRUPbFIAmTlNhD6RA.text: Came in and it was packed so they sat us as the first table of two upstairs.  There had to be 6 additional tables of two also upstairs one no more then 8 inches next to us. The next table of two came up and was sat right next to us??  Now upstairs was totally empty ( no reservation signs) and they sat them there why? With the downstairs being so busy sound carries and  was impossible to have a personal conversation with people practically sitting with us. Even when the waiter came to serve them his bottom was on our table...seriously! Once the other couple left we asked to speak with the manager and asked why it was done this way ( later other couples came and where settled in the father spots) she had no answer except she would speak with the staff.  In the end they did nothing to make the situation better and I would never recommend anyone to go there. Food was just o.k. Sticky rice was hard and difficult to get out of the bamboo container.

aPiOS99s7vYdDdrU61dXtg.text: Not bad, but not memorable. There's nothing I can point to as bad (there really wasn't). I had a prawn curry, some mixed appetizers, and a coconut mango icecream. They were all good. But there was just something missing about the whole meal. The spices weren't quite spicy enough, the flavors weren't subtle enough, but nothing I can point to directly.

EdV_i0WpUvv9WByTun9r8w.text: This place looks really nice and the prices are not at all that expensive if you are on the British Pound instead of the measly dollar.  It is right by Trafalgar Square which is great because it is between my hotel and the theaters, so I decided to grab a bite to eat before my show.  I have had Thai food in a number of different countries so I decided to go all out and get a big spread because this place was so packed on a Monday night.The prawn dumpling was full of prawn flavor but it seemed unoriginal or not inspired because the dumpling was served with what tasted like canned or bottled sauce.  The green curry was average, no real explosion of flavors I would expect from a good curry and I had it with the coconut rice which was a waste of money because there was no discernible tasted different between that and regular steam rice.I said I was going to order me a spread so I decided to splurge on a coconut sundae.  The presentation was very nice, but the flavors were eradicate going from semi-sweet to dull, only thing that saved this from been left on the table was the texture which was felt original.I would skip this if looking for good Thai food in London, there are definitely better places in London.  Actually I think I have had better when I was in Berlin.

bjUn7_RnA-AnG-vG9-X5HA.text: We're in London, so what the hell, go to a Thai restaurant!The inside is really beautiful and tastefully decorated.  My wife kept mentioning the beautiful orchids that were arranged beautifully.  Actually, this is probably the first time in my life that I actually cared how flowers looked.  The appetizer, some kind of fried duck, was great!Both of our main entrees were also very good.  Mine was duck with tamarind sauce and I won the contest of who gets the best dish.  My wife had the lamb with coconut sauce and in my opinion was bland.This Thai restaurant was playing Brazilian music...  I know that Brazilian music is awesome and great to set the mood, but come on, give me some saucy Thai music.I'm staring to figure out this whole eating in London thing.  The waiter/waitress only comes over after you have already looked at your menu and closed it.  Otherwise, they don't seem to come over.  This seems to be the case everywhere...  If the wife allows, I'll be back.

hgTQSiE1aqAvvzVELQfsoQ.text: On the outside, this looks like a tourist trap right on the edge of Trafalgar Square, but although it is a bit overpriced for Thai, the food is pretty good. I had a chicken dish with cashews and vegetables and my friend had one of the curries. All pretty standard. A good place to go if you're in the area and need a quick place to eat.

GcS609gHhiTZFl9nIkIhIg.text: Thai Square at Trafalgar Square is a really good restaurant.I'm really fond of their dishes, its varied, colourful delicious and extremely delicious! it is the sort of place that you can start with a dinner and end up on the dance floor if you wish, as there's a club downstairs. So a great place to visit and enjoy great Thai cuisine, while in the centre, checking out the vibrant night life around Trafalgar Square. The staff are nice and friendly, great vegetarian dishes, and and a nice, stylish decor.

nqhYW9nUs9ActVRz_r4sdQ.text: Used to be good. Now suffering from 'The over expansion chain' of cutting corners, costs and taking the eye of the customer experience ball. Not just this one, the Thai Square in South Ken and Richmond are also just shovelling it out as quick as they can in an effort to maximise money taken versus bums on seats. shame they used to be good.

x1SMS_1JLDs042P4pVdUtg.text: We started with the Thai appetizer sampler which gives you a sampling of everything and was very good. I had the green curry with was delicious and just enough heat to it. My wife did the Pad Thai which did not disappoint. Another member of our party had the whole sea bass dinner which was surprisingly good. I would highly recommend if your looking for Thai food.

fA2m9cjiyC_IVwDqfzTGKA.text: Extensive vegetarian menu. Flavorful food. Presentation lacks imagination, but you can't eat presentation.  Prices are competitive, which makes them attractive if you like quality food.  By-the-glass wine selection could be improved. Décor was typical but slightly cramped and noisy. All in all, the food was the winner here. Convenient to Trafalgar and Piccadilly.

6Hz5pB6jQlWrUp4U8bgBlA.text: Our first night in London and we decided to go here because it was close to our hotel.  We both got the Pre-Theater Prix Fix menu:Chicken Satay, Eggroll, Siu Mei, and Fish CakeChicken CurryVegetarian Pad ThaiCashew Chicken with mango and soy sauceCoconut Ice CreamFor £14.50pp, it was a good deal of food for the price for 2.  The appetizers were good enough - we just decided not to compare the Thai food we have in the States.  I have to say that leaving our reference points at home helped in that we experienced foods fresh from a different perspective.  The curry had nice flavors, but the chicken was just too dry.  It was clear they used chicken breast and I think for a curry, or any kind of stew, you really need thigh/rib meat so it doesn't get overly dry.  The vegetarian Pad Thai was a little too sweet for my taste.  The cashew chicken was good, especially with the rice.All in all, a good enough meal for our first night, but we were headed for better pastures elsewhere in London, especially after realizing that Thai Square was a chain restaurant.If you're craving some Asian food, this could be a good spot to satisfy a craving, but there are better places to go in London.

4VcXFVloJuCIMdOFSrUoRw.text: Just another club, with a little bit better on priced drinks. 3 stars! Bunch of asians... and thats an understatement.. more like a club with only asians. the drinks are decent priced, and its a small club.don't bring fake id's here, they scan em on the computer, etc etc. and there is a 5 quid cover charge... i would not pay 5 quid to this shit place again

v6kaYL0WiqnH8n1YcWd5bw.text: Presentation is wonderful. Soft lighting, everything looks great definitely. Nicely dressed waitresses and all that good stuff. I had the Drunken Duck, which was actually pretty good. Lots of flavor in the food. The egg fried rice couldve been more fried and more eggy though seriously. It was like they chopped up an egg and threw it in some steamed rice so I wasn't too happy with that.The person I was with got some noodles with giant shrimp in them and I thought it was really good. Don't like how they automatically add gratuity - you would normally get more if you didn't force people to pay it.Good place to stop for lunch or dinner definitely. In a nice area with Trafalgar Square just across the street.  Def check it out if you get a chance.

Ym4bcAMs-zlyH5jSdFMpCw.text: Very expensive and not great service. Food was nice not exceptional

BZyY6TkB5YQRiYtmjHUdMQ.text: It was good food, a bit more pricey than other places around, but it is a great environment and the food was excellent.  The sticky rice with mango for dessert was awesome.  The mangos melted in your mouth.

gjwE4-LtaNWgYc9geZCc2Q.text: The food was excellent, their service impeccable, and they had us out the door within an hour at the pre-theatre rush, despite the 3 course meal. Would definitely recommend this. Delicious, efficient, with a lovely ambience inside.

Lo4w8FgCh2oyhtm-6wNdIQ.text: I'm loving Thai food recently and I have to say, this one delivered the goods! We went there after a westend show, having missed the chance to eat beforehand. I can honestly say that it was worth the wait! The food is delicious and delightfully presented. The staff are courteous and attentive and the bill not too huge for the middle of town. If it loses a star, its because of the men mountain types outside providing security for the place. Looked more like something out of a 30's gangster flick than a restaurant! I suppose downtime, that time of night. Anyway  well worth a visit, I would say.

xYO5SgZHVLF4faVeg7YHGA.text: A very nice, friendly atmosphere. The food was delicious, and the staff was courteous. Definitely the best Thai in the area.

5O923JTwt4yRkfeERbyO_Q.text: Perfect location, food was terrible, service even worse. There are so many wonderful places to go, avoid this one despite it's enticing exterior and convenience. Vegetables were not fresh, wraps seemed to have been frozen.

i4Fx03QRy3UKWAzGv1dmRQ.text: A nice location, beautiful interior and attentive staff.However for the reason that I went there, food seemed just a bit above average. I had the pad si-ew which was flavourful but really oily towards the end. Also ordered a tom yum goong which had a kick to it but didn't amaze me too much. They also had live music with a traditional Thai instrument I'm presuming, which was nice though from where I was sitting it was overpowered by the general chatter.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful presentation but all I remember was the oil towards the end of the Pad Si-ew.

DbDcsUnJOrRgaRIKms6x2w.text: Same thing happened to us. We weren't given the option of tap water. We were asked sparkling or still water. We asked for still, thinking it would come in complimentary carafe of water. When the water came, we were surprised and she immediately opened the bottle and pour into our glasses before we can do anything, and have to pay for it. Remember to always ask whether water served is complimentary or not. Spoke with the manager who insisted that's how the business is run and we have to specifically ask for tap water if we want free water. Pretty much spoiled the whole dining experience. Don't bother with the pad see ew, one of the worst I've eaten so far. It looked and taste as it was simmered with soy sauce rather than actual stir fry.

dZBG8MF8hf_LgmVdbfj6OA.text: We were walking towards the 'Her Majesty's Theater when we cam across this restaurant, it was lunch time anyway so we decided to come in and checkout the restaurant.  The place seems empty as most people are shopping at the oxford circus crossing since it's Boxing Day here in London kind like Black Friday in US.  The servers are really nice and hospitable, spoke to a young man one of the staff and he had given us more info about the area, specially the close by 'China Town' the food we had was fabulous and us we start eating, people of great number start pouring and filling the whole place.  The staff provided us friendly warm welcome and the food was so delicious.  For sure we wanted to get back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Plain vegetable with chicken soup
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Garlic Squid
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Pad Thai with prawns

CmVbo6badA3lmETpelie_w.text: I ordered a pre-theater 3 course dinner. It's usually available for two guess but they accommodate this lone diner. The place was beautifully decorated with Thai influences in a elegant and modern style. Christmas decorations were installed with taste. Speaking of taste, the food was excellent. I ordered shrimp and scallops for dinner. Seafood was fresh and the flavor was very nice. Appetizer was delicious and dessert put this place over the top. Service was also very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom

0yVVn93zSK5hKZasqKtr7Q.text: Terrible service. Over rated and expensive Thai food. They charge for water and shrimp chips and make it seem complementary.

Y5Gg-oi59x5L1yZs08oFnw.text: They didn't give us a tap water option than charged us 9 pounds for water. The waitress asked us if we wanted crackers and we thought it was complementary but they charged us for it. They rudely snatched our menus from our hands. The lady over the phone was nice. They never once asked us if our food was ok.

LgYR0P5Q1YOw11mcYENUAg.text: I'm working my way through London - one thai restaurant at a time. On a cold, rainy day (which a vast majority have been over the past couple of months) I end up craving spicy, hot thai or indian.  Thai Square is an upscale thai chain.  This one is located off of Trafalgar Square, so attracts its fair share of tourists and while ingredient quality, service and decor are nice --- you pay for the location.  Here are my other thoughts:- Decor 4 stars: Nice white linen setting with high ceilings.  There's an upstairs dining area - but choose something next to the window if you can to watch the crowds go by.  During dinner a woman was in the main dining room playing thai music.- Service 4 stars : Very good - prompt, friendly. - Menu 4+ stars: Extensive menu for both those that like spicy and non-spicy, familiar to less familiar - so good for everyone.    Typical starters - tempura, Satay,, curries, soups, veggie menu etc. Nice "Family or Date" 2-3 course menu options available for 2+ people. Like most places they charge extra for rice --- which I skipped.Good wine list. My Meal 3-4 Stars:  I had the Tom Yum Goong Soup with Shrimp, and a House Special Prawn and Scallops with garlic, sweet peas and baby corn.  On the plus side: terrific high-quality and well cooked ingredients: great big prawns, perfectly cooked scallops/prawns in both dishes, pea pods, baby corn, shitake mushrooms in the soup.Flavor wasn't as good as I hoped on the prawn/scallop dish ( for some reason there's no soy, hot chili sauce, pepper - or well,  anything-  to amp it up on your own.).  Both had a lot of oil in them that overwhelmed the freshness of those great ingredients. BOTTOM LINE: So, it's a nice place, in a good location serving fresh quality ingredient dishes with authentic flavors. Probably, a really great place for a date. But, while independently I'd give everything 4-stars - I've given it an A-OK 3 star rating. All that still didn't add up to a great  value to me.given the prices and size of what was provided.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Thai horse decoration best into the bar

wispMnJbquBtS8T1pzv0Cg.text: Stopped in Thai Square for lunch on a rainy London day.It's a beautiful restaurant .. service was impeccable.Food ---- eh, it was good, but it wasn't best ever. It was definitely a welcome respite from the rain and cold, but we've had better for less.

HI3YQO0YXwJZ-AwzkH0eng.text: First, the restaurant is gorgeous and the staff is very friendly and warm. However, the food isnt so great. We had the corn cake appetizers, they were very dry and stale. We ordered Gold Curry with chicken and potatoes, it was delicious but very little chicken. We tried the coconut rice which was delicious and the veggie skewers which were terrible, just a shriveled piece of fried tofu and some sliced onions and peppers and a tiny tomato, not good at all. We finished with a mango crepe dessert and the filling and ice cream were good but the crepe was very bitter. Its too bad, such a beautiful restaurant but probably wouldnt go back.

bWSZhPSGF2MFVeJXEOxtHA.text: Really good Thai food. I have pretty severe food allergies and it was such a relief to see allergens called out on the menu. My waiter helped modify some selections and even went to the kitchen to confirm they understood and could accommodate. The restaurant is a bit loud but it wasn't intrusive.I will be back when we are back in town!

pefR0kqM4IFyeGsgNACIRw.text: Great location and Great vegaterian options for us veggies.  The service was quick and actually really great. Located at trafalgar square,  near Westminster,  national museum,  a short walk to any of the plays. The decor was nice.  Even a thai girl playing music dressed traditionally We ate the vegaterian pad Thai which is the best we had I  the city and the portion size was great. We also ordered the green Curry vegaterian dish also extremely Delish and a large portion Coconut rice which was good but a high price for size of serving at 3.50£ Bathrooms were awful,  not clean,  extra supplies laid out,  I had to go open my own pack of tissue.  Needs a serous deep cleaning.  I am always disappointed when a restaurant does not keep their toilets clean it always makes me wonder what else is not important to them to clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Vegaterian spring rolls.
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Vegaterian pad Thai and Green  Curry,  Coconut Rice

J_54SiEPcyQhO-HqJIvotQ.text: It was Sunday evening and time for dinner just didn't know what we were in the mood for, so I whipped out my handy Yelp App to look at some choices and after looking over the menu we settled on Thai Square and was even able to make a reservation through my Yelp App, pretty sweet I say.Made our way to Thai Square, I told the host we had reservations, she looked at her book and didn't see any, but another lady went to the back and came out and addressed me by name, I thought that was a nice touch and we were shown to our seats. I have to say, Thai Square is very nice, felt swanky, hence the reason for no food pics, just felt like I shouldn't haha.I started with Chicken Satay, it's the peanut sauce that I really crave and well I wanted to see if it's just as good in London as it is in Phoenix and yep it's amazing! The chicken had great flavor, it is sort of sad to cover it with the peanut sauce for it could stand on its own, but omg I love the peanut sauce and since I can't just eat with a spoon its best it goes on the chicken. For my drink I ordered the Thai Tea, it was perfectly blended and tasted great! For the main dish, I went with the Panang Beef Thai Hot (been told food in London is bland so I was thinking Thai Hot really wasn't going to be hot on my heat scale) . This was prime beef that had been slow cooked in coconut cream and Panang curry paste and it was garnished with lime leaves, I also ordered a side of coconut rice. When the meal came out it looked amazing, the server placed the food on the table then served me, that's right, she placed curry on my plate followed by some rice, felt kind of spoiled.  The Panang Beef was amazing, the flavors the texture, oh so good! And going Thai Hot was perfect for me. That was a great curry dish. Now I'll have to find it here in Phoenix or cook it myself.Glad to have found Thai Square on my Yelp App, look forward to coming back.

fkvZLVqeG1GwE3fZf_GHOA.text: In London from the States, and popped in since it is close to our hotel.   Everything is just delicious!  The red curry, the garlic spinach, the desserts...all wonderful.  The service is great as well!  My only disappointment is that there isn't a location back home in Southern California.

lywcM8_MfxxW4XEynDJWWg.text: Fantastic location especially for pre theatre dinner, they also offer pre theatre menu. It is located right by Trafalgar Square and not many restaurant have a view across iconic landmarks but this one does.It is a typical overpriced central London restaurant where quantity and quality are compromised for high prices but that should be expected. Inside is chill, cozy and nicely decorated with soft lighting and food was good and lots of options for Vegans/Vegetarians as well as Meat eaters.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Papaya salad

6ViOSkwyGzrsR9LsVU3QAA.text: The lunch special for £9.95 is a filling meal for an average appetite. The green curry was spiced well and the meal is flavorful. Also, the spicy seafood soup is true to description and delicious. It's a great lunch spot from the Natural History Museum and Victoria & Albert Museum. The restaurant is a bit snug and beautifully decorated. Also, great service.

NK4j8VuDQFAmZX2SvyfOZA.text: Um they came out running as we were about to leave to with the credit card machine asking for our card again because they forgot to charge for an iced tea beverage. Tack-y. Food was edible at most. Skip.

NdSPK-HUh3oRqynnAmVUvQ.text: I got the chicken satay and the weeping tiger beef. Both were good, but I really love Thai food and wasn't very impressed. The service and atmosphere were both nice. A bit on the expensive side though - 28£ pre-tip.

lWr3C0UZ4wb6B3MLTGoc1g.text: Solid four stars on all fronts, and good value for the money.  Great decor, very good service, delicious dinner with good portion sizes.  Prices more reasonable than some of what we had experienced earlier in the week.  Sorry we didn't try this place earlier in the week.

W_iJ3araZzzZriat-BZlWg.text: Favorite thai restaurant when we are in London. We enjoyed the starter which is called golden sacks (shrimp ball), thai papaya salad, massamum curry, fried flat rice noodle, pad Thai, and tamarind duck. The pre theatre menu is half price before 7.30pm, what a good deal for good food.  Service is top and sometimes they offered prawn crackers (not sure why it is not consistent in my every visit). Recommended to colleagues and friends and they love it too.

VpoY6Fbz0kXOlWhaphyyww.text: Expensive for what it was. Small plates and really not inspired chefs. The service a little bit busy on other things rather than see our friend waiting for his main dish 30 minutes more than us. Better Thais in other districts

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Starters of the 30 menu
